title: When I’m Gone
description: Wiz' debut album,  Rolling Papers , starts with an emo-track answering the haters who accuse him of only rapping about money, weed & bitches. Of course, he doesn’t provide any semblance of an answer.. but the song is quite emotional..

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: And they say all I rap about, bitches 'n' champagne
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: ‘Ballin’‘ is street slang used to describe someone who is living a lavish lifestyle. Although Wiz is not a 'baller’ (a basketball player) nor in anyway associated with the NBA, he is still living lavish.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: You would too if every night you seen the same thing
Money wall to wall, young famous nigga
Spend it all, when you die, you can't take it with ya
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Wiz and the Taylor Gang are big fans of luxurious liquor, referencing Gin, Clicquot and Bombay on several different songs.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Bottle of rose if I'm drinkin' with ya
'Cause most niggas broke, their bank is injured
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Some people think it is not good when you just start making a lot of money fast usually because you are expected to have a sharp contrast between your new lifestyle and your old one. By saying “some say it’s a problem” he’s referring to the title of  Notorious B.I.G’s Mo' Money Mo' Problems.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Then bitches gonna ride with who they think's a winner
'N' I'll be smilin' in case they take a picture
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: All the hoes he has in his car want to experience how fast his car ishttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Os5_-UWLCBs

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Oh, I'm smokin' weed, drinkin' liquor
Make a hundred off the show, 'n' spend it all on my niggas
When I go shoppin', I tell them pick one
'Cause they was with me when nobody seen a vision
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: According to Songfacts, Wiz declared to Billboard this was the last verse he wrote for the entire album:I said, this is it! I was like, how do we end it and begin it at the same time?

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Always about my business, don't play the card
I talked to the niggas who deal them, uh
Royal flush, now look up them niggas
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Double entendre:Wiz Khalifa would rather talk about rap than play no-limit hold emWiz doesn’t get business cards made because he can’t find a nice embossed print that he likesPrototype for a Wiz Khalifa business card:

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: 'N', baby girl, you see us, yeah
I'm gonna spend it all (all)
Why wait for another day? (day)
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Wiz Khalifa’s dad was in the military, which has the motto Carpe Diem, or “seize the day”. So he is living for the day, just like the motto that his father followed.

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: I'ma take all this money I own (own)
'N' blow it all away (away)
'Cause I can't take it when I'm gone, gone, gone, gone, gone
No, I can't take it when I'm gone, gone, gone, gone, gone, gone
I'm gonna spend it all (all)
Why wait for another day? (day)
I'ma take all this money I own (own)
'N' blow it all away (away)
'Cause I can't take it when I'm gone, gone, gone, gone, gone
No, I can't take it when I'm gone, gone, gone, gone, gone
No, I can't take it when I'm gone
Look at all the ho's in my car, they wanna feel at that maximum speed
Never have a absence of weed
Tired of bein' at the bar, everything Louis V
Plus the most exclusive treat in my jar
lyrics_and_annotations.annotation: Blowing my greens” is a double entendre, as Wiz could be blowing some sticky green or he could be spending his money, which is the color of green. Collards are a green colored plant in the same species as broccoli and cabbage. “

lyrics_and_annotations.lyric: Makin' my bank, spendin' it all
And that expensive shit you paid for, she had it on
I'ma take all this money I own (own)
